name: 英語會話（二）
description: 本課旨在提高學生英語會話之動機與信心，擴展其英語會話相關知識，及提昇其英語會話技巧。藉由導正參與會話之心態及學習與會話相關之言談特色、溝通策略、肢體語言及社會文化，學生可望在不同場合(如一般社交和工作面試)面對不同人士或使用不同溝通媒介(面對面或講電話)時以更輕鬆的心情及更適切的方式參與、進行（即開啟、延續、及結束）英語會話。本課程之授課方式主要以兩人對話型式討論相關文獻及運用演練所學之會話知識和技巧。學習評量包含學生個人的平時課堂參與、課堂小考、二至三段考以及小組與個人報告等。
goals: Acquire the attitude that is conducive to having English conversation.
Know the stages involved in the English conversation process.
Acquire the skills to open, sustain and close an English conversation.
Learn the vocabulary for topics commonly mentioned in daily conversations.
Acquire the skills to perform FTA’s (Face Threatening Acts) like requesting, rejecting a request, hiding true feelings, and deflecting embarrassing questions.
Learn how to conduct phone conversations.
Acquire the knowledge and ability to conduct conversations at a job interview.
syllabus:
**ENU0270 English Conversation (II)**

**WHEN**      Thursdays, 3:30-5:20 pm

**WHERE**    Cheng 701B (誠701B)

**PROFESSOR**

        詹曉蕙Shiao-hui Chan

        Email: shiaohui@ntnu.edu.tw

        Office: Cheng 707 (誠707)

        Office hours: By appointment

        Course web page: https://moodle2.ntnu.edu.tw/

**COURSE DESCRIPTION**

This class is to help students improve their English speaking skills through activities, such as in-class discussions, interviews with foreigners and outside class event participation.

**REQUIRED TEXT**

McCarthy, M., McCarten, J., & Sandiford, H. (2014). Touchstone Student's Book 4. Cambridge: Cambridge University Press.

**COURSE REQUIREMENTS**

Class participation (attendance, Q & A sessions, etc.): 15%

Assignments: 20%

English event participation (inquiry and practice): 15%

Group project (inquiry and practice): 30%

Final exam: 20%

**Assignments**

Students are expected to prepare their assignments before class. During class meeting times, they will be grouped by lots drawing to give a 5-minute "group presentation". The presenters should try to make their presentation as close to a natural conversation as possible, by, for example, applying strategies learned in class. There will be a 3-5 minute Q & A session after the presentation.

**English event/activity participation**

Students are expected to participate in an event/activity where English is the major communication language, such as talks given by English speakers, events held by the Office of International Affairs, language exchange programs with English speaking partners, etc. Students should record a 2-minute individual or group video presentation with at least one photo of their participation to introduce the event. The video (or video link) should be uploaded to Moodle before Week 12.

**Group projects**

Toward the end of the semester, students are required to do a group project (2-3 students per group) with a foreigner. This interview needs to be video-taped and presented to class following the specified format. Through this interview, students should try to find out interesting things in the interviewee’s country and share them with the class in the presentation.

Presentation length: 20 minutes in total, including:

1) 3-minute Introduction     2) 7-minute Video showing

3) 5-minute Summary       4) 5-minute Q & A session

Each presentation will be rated by the audience (online).

Each presenter will self-evaluate their contribution to the project (online).

**SCHEDULE OF TOPICS**

Week 1    Course overview & Unit 7: Problem solving & assignment of final project groups

Week 2    Unit 7: Problem solving

Week 3    Unit 8: Behavior

Week 4  Unit 8: Behavior

Week 5    Assignment #1: Describe a situation where you had to solve a difficult problem and whether you overcame the obstacle creatively or you regretted what you had done.

Week 6  No class (Spring break)

Week 7    Unit 4: Socializing

Week 8    Unit 4: Socializing

Week 9    Unit 12: Careers

Week 10  Unit 12: Careers

Week 11  Assignment #2: What do you think you’ll be doing in 10 years?

Week 12  Presentation for English Event Participation

Week 13  Group project presentation

Week 14  Group project presentation

Week 15  Review New Year’s Resolution(s)

Week 16  Final Exam
